Docs.summary: Provides a factory class that creates instances of the authentication service, role service, and profile service in managed hosting environments.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This factory class provides a way to create instances of the <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationService>, <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ProfileService>, and <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.RoleService> classes.
To use this factory class, create a WCF Service (.svc) file and specify <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ApplicationServicesHostFactory> in the `ServiceHosting` attribute of the `@ ServiceHost` directive.
## Examples The following example shows how to specify <xref:System.Web.ApplicationServices.ApplicationServicesHostFactory> in the `@ ServiceHost` directive of a .svc file to configure the authentication service.
```csharp <%@ ServiceHost Language="C#" Service="System.Web.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationService" Factory="System.Web.ApplicationServices.ApplicationServicesHostFactory" %>
```
```vb <%@ ServiceHost Language="VB" Service="System.Web.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationService" Factory="System.Web.ApplicationServices.ApplicationServicesHostFactory" %> ```
